Once Mustex and Ice were out of range Veratis opened the CR. "Would you like
to explain your actions or should I show you out the door?" the old
scientist was furious with his guest for lashing out like that, he had
opened his door as a sign of peace and this bot seemed to want to destroy
everything inside. Veratis would not let that lack of social skills
continue.
----- Original Message -----
From: <hugar_twriker@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, August 21, 2001 2:42 PM
Subject: Re: Party at Veratis'


�Grizzltron�


   Grizzltron remained in the cr chamber.



--- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Mustex growled as Grizzltron fired at him. If Ice hadn't stepped
between them the blast would have hit him. He reached to draw his
weapon when Ice rose her wings blocking his shot. "Get down!," he
yelled trying to take aim at the insane bot.
>
> "None of that in here." Ice yelled equally demanding, "This is a
place of peace and it'll stay that way."
>
> Grizzltron wasn't very happy that thier chat was inturupted. He
fealt outnumbered and outgunned. His firepower was the only thing
seperating him and the odds. Veratis wrapped his large bat wings
around the bear bot and used his unseemingly strength to hold
Grizzltrons arms at his sides. "I already warned you once that that
will not be permitted in my home." The old scientist bit down on the
other bots shoulder draining enough energy to weaken him enough to
force him into a CR chamber.
>
> "That should give him some time to cool down." Veratis says
transforming back to his robot mode. "Now then Mustex was it? Take
Ice with you and bring your "son" to me and I'll take good care of
him."
>
> Ice didn't want to go that way, she wanted to return to Lunarpine
and the others. She thought about thier times together and had to go
with Mustex, She remembered all the times she'd tried to help her
love and ended up getting herself hurt and in one case nearly lost
her spark. This time she'd trust him to get the job done without
worrying about her.
